オプション1: Star Man looked up at the sky and sighed.

オプション1: The twilight never seemed to fade into true night.
It was hard to tell how much time had passed.
He stood up, stretching his sore muscles.
A faint rustling sound caught his attention.
He turned toward it, tense but curious.
From behind the bushes, a small figure emerged.
It was a child with a square-shaped head.
The boy looked just as surprised to see Star Man.
They stared at each other in silence.
Then the child spoke. 'You're not from here, are you?'
